isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Oil Cooler and Filter Housing - Cleaning, Inspection, and Testing - Oil Cooler Cover Assembly Leaks (Coolant Side)

svcproc.title: Oil Cooler Cover Assembly Leaks (Coolant Side)

figure.caption: Oil cooler cover assembly pressure test

calloutgroup.callout1: Oil Cooler Pressure Test Plate ZTSE4730

note.para: The oil filter base assembly and new gaskets must be installed on the oil cooler cover assembly before a pressure test can be done. The new gaskets can be reused for final assembly.

step1.para:
Install Oil Cooler Pressure Test Plate ZTSE4730
on oil cooler cover assembly.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para:
Attach an air pressure regulator
to oil cooler pressure test plate. Connect to compressed air supply and adjust air pressure to approximately 172 to 207 kPa (25 to 30 psi).

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not submerge the oil cooler in water. This will introduce water into oil passages.

step1.para: Spray soapy water on oil cooler and between oil cooler and oil cooler cover.
Inspect for air bubbles on the oil cooler as well as between oil cooler and oil cooler cover.
If leaks are detected, install a new oil cooler cover assembly.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Remove soapy water residue and blow off with compressed air.
